intro: Ouratea hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Brazilian holly or white holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen, glossy, elliptical leaves and its clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It produces dark blue, waxy berries that are edible for some bird species. Ouratea hildebrandtii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal floral display.
